channel.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
channel.description:
Ok well now I have no compiler errors but when i login heres my run.bat (cmd) logs
i have this error when i login my server. It will login, i can't move or teleport, then i dc every 5 seconds like a cycle.
[code] ClientHandler: Accepted from 127.0.0.1:52389 LoginPacket size: 70, RSA packet size: 30 Client type: high memory version dataFileVersion[0]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[1]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[2]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[3]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[4]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[5]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[6]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[7]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[8]: 0x0 UserId: 13131313 Ident: 3213:21 inStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x9b1063 inStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x45de8b inStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x5ddbd1c inStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x2ffb1f5 outStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x9b1095 outStreamSessionKey[1]: 0x45debd outStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x5ddbd4e outStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x2ffb227 [client-1-3213]: Loading finished. What did i do wrong?

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Ive been looking at it and I can’t find any problem… I ran it with netbeans and connected with a client and no errors came up, but I didn’t get past the client back ground…

Read full topic
item.source: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Private message me a link to your server code.

Read full topic
item.source: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @weeddamn weeddamn
item.description:
@weeddamn wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:11, topic:443432”]The cycle rate isn’t 5 seconds… It’s 1/2 a second, but it should really be 600ms. Look for both 1,000,000 and 255.

The 1,000,000 is most likely what you had your buffer set to which is far to high… Find 1,000,000 and change it to 10,000. For the 255 are you logging in a massive amount of players?[/quote]

I changed my buffer size from 1000000 to 10000 and all it did was make me dc quicker now when i login i don’t disconnect every 5 seconds i disconnect every 1 second. And idk what to do about the byte 255

Read full topic
item.source: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The cycle rate isn’t 5 seconds… It’s 1/2 a second, but it should really be 600ms. Look for both 1,000,000 and 255.

The 1,000,000 is most likely what you had your buffer set to which is far to high… Find 1,000,000 and change it to 10,000. For the 255 are you logging in a massive amount of players?

Read full topic
item.source: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @weeddamn weeddamn
item.description:
@weeddamn wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:9, topic:443432”] public PlayerSave loadGame(String playerName, String playerPass) { PlayerSave tempPlayer; try { ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream("./savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")); tempPlayer = (PlayerSave) in.readObject(); in.close(); } catch(Exception e){ return null; } return tempPlayer; }
Add that to IOHandler class[/quote]

K it’s added. No Compiler errors but now i have this error when i login my server. It will login, i can’t move or teleport, then i dc every 5 seconds like a cycle.

In my runserver.bat it says

item.title: Graham's Thread per Client Errors! PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

public PlayerSave loadGame(String playerName, String playerPass) { PlayerSave tempPlayer; try { ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream("./savedGames/"+playerName+".dat")); tempPlayer = (PlayerSave) in.readObject(); in.close(); } catch(Exception e){ return null; } return tempPlayer; }
Add that to IOHandler class

Read full topic

@Skyro wrote:

Try and change

loadGame

to

c.loadGame

If this doesn’t work, then you’ll need to wait for someone more ‘advanced’ to help you.
